channel.title: Script help
channel.description: Okay when i move the mouse to a certain position how do i make it find the uptext and then save certain words of it as const's. Is this even possible?

Did you use SetUpSRL;?

The first thing in your main loop should be SetupSRL;

item.title: Script help
item.dc:creator: @bullzeye95 bullzeye
item.description:
@bullzeye95 wrote:

For FindNormalRandomsChoice, you use true and false. [scar] FindNormalRandomsChoice(true,true,true,true,true,true,true,true,true,true,true,true,true,true,true)[/scar]
Do that if you want to find them all. As for the second question, I don’t know.

item.title: Script help
item.dc:creator: @junior junior
item.description:
@junior wrote:

Ok how can i include that in a procedure like this…

[scar]
procedure Findfood;
begin
if(invfull=true)then
begin
Food:= GetColor(586, 225);
Food2:= GetColor(585, 229);

end else
if(invfull=false)then
begin
logout;
writeln(‘Food not found in Inventory, Logged out.’)
terminatescript;
end;
end;
[/scar]

Where it says _________ i want it to save the up text of that certain peice of food.

Read full topic

item.title: Script help
item.dc:creator: @Cheesehunk Cheesehunk
item.description:
@Cheesehunk wrote:

Yes, it is possible. Here, try something like this:
[scar]program New;
{.include SRL\SRL.scar}

Function MouseGetUpText(x, y, RandY, RandY, WaitTime :integer): String;
var i : integer;
begin
MMouse(x, y, RandY, RandY);
for i := 0 to 4 do
begin
wait(WaitTime+random(50));
Result:=GetUpText;
if ( Length(Result) > 0 ) then Exit;
end;
end;

begin
if Findcolor(x,y,color,x1,y1,x2,y2) then
begin
If ( MouseGetUpText(x,y,1,1,100) = ‘Mine’) then
Mouse(x,y,0,0,true);
end;
end.[/scar]

Read full topic
